achievement_name: I Used to Be an Adventurer
achievement_desc: Then I took an arrow to the horse. She's all better now, though.
You destroyed a man’s livelihood and smashed something up while you were at it. You’re a true Hero.
You laid to rest the spirits of a platoon of morons. They’re another dimension’s problem now.
You dished out a veritable smorgasbord of spell power. Delicious.
Ten stingers in five seconds. How long for the other 600,000?
You made it out of Bladebarrow. Most don’t.
You dismantled a hollow man. It’s just a (rotting) flesh-wound!
You purchased ten upgrades. Your powers are beginning to soar. Soar like a chicken.
You opened 15 chests. Now on to the greater mystery: Whose stuff have you been stealing?
You killed 15 enemies with their own attacks. Reflect on your progress, and feel proud.
Roast chicken is the best smell in the world. Unless you’re a chicken.
You killed three enemies with one Fireball. Goodness gracious.
You killed a hobbe with his own bomb. ‘Tis the sport to have the enginer hoist with his own petar.
A good driver keeps their hands on the reins at all times, apart from when they’re killing things.
You killed 500 enemies. The Grim Reaper loves round numbers.
The Devourer has been defeated, and Fergus is at rest. There’s no turning back now, Hero.
You killed 20 enemies in midair. Flying’s fine – it’s landing that hurts. Also, the magic spells.
Burning through the sky at 200 degrees. That’s why they call him Mr. Pushed-in-the-Lava.
You fully upgraded one of your spells. You’ll be able to bring down anything now.
You emerged unscathed from a troll fight. Problem?
You healed ten wounds on Seren. If she walked into a bar and bruised herself, you’d heal that too.
You dealt with a travelling enemy by making it crash and die. Ben Hur would be proud.
You made it to the barn and saw off the White Balverine (with a little help from your friends).
You got cosy with a balverine. You must have nerves of steel -- and no working olfactory system.
You purchased five upgrades. Your Journey has begun.
You rescued Fergus from a spot of Hobbe bother. Your reward? Singing and beans.
You killed three enemies with thrown objects. Down in front!
There it is! You killed ten creatures with explosive barrels.
You juggled a hobbe. A career in the circus awaits. A pretty odd circus, admittedly.
You tried your hand at all camp activities. Way to go, cowboy.
You ran down an enemy with your cart. Consider investing in a plough.

Noble 1: Your team blew up the research facility in a matchmade Invasion game on Breakpoint.
Your dedication to the art of key-getting is laudable. No ordinary key-getter you.
Oh, you're tough, you are. Destroying tiny, bearded, pointy-hatted, immobile men. How could you?
You have collected all the rare desert flowers and returned a sense of cultutal heritage to Aurora.
You have uncovered every last piece of Hero lore. The Road to Rule is a road well travelled.
You beat an inanimate object at chess. Although to be fair, it is a very evil inanimate object.
You got all the way to the end without being knocked out. Well, there was that time in the desert...
You killed the Crawler and ended the greatest threat ever to loom over Albion. You are a legend.
You are the ultimate Hero. A master in every discipline. In other words, you're awesome.
Hunting for treasure isn't always glamourous. The dirt under your fingernails can attest to that.
You have finished your training.

Good for you. Why bring more people into the world when there are poor, parentless children around?
You've amassed a fortune in real estate. Just as well there's no window tax.
Magic holds no secrets for you. If it did, you'd probably cast a "make magic talk" spell on it.
They called you a nerd. They called you spotty. They mocked your beard. So you killed them all.
You brought a real sense of gravitas to your role of monarch. That and feathers.
You led a revolution and now the throne is yours. How will history judge your rule?
You convinced the Aurorans to to join your cause. It's time for a revolution!
Thanks to you, there is a new, thriving community away from the stresses of the modern world.
Not even death can put squabbling siblings to rest, but at least they're safely back with Mother.
Few have ever put the trigger to such bloody use.
You scored 2000 on the Mourningwood Fort mortar game. Private Jammy is proud of you.
The people of Bowerstone are behind you, ready to stand up against your brother.
You rescued a piece of cardboard and gained valuable insight into the game development process.
Major Swift and his men have joined your cause. How can you fail with that moustache on your side?
You may well be the first Hero in history to weave two spells together. And wasn't it pretty?
You've taken your first steps towards gathering a rebel force to stand against your brother.
Your literary investigations have unearthed a one-of-a-kind play. Shame it stinks.

The Guild Seal reacted to your touch. You're a Hero! But then, you knew that already.
You've held hands with another person. What better way to make a connection?
